name: Creamy Chicken Noodle Casserole
description: A creamy, cheesy casserole packed with tender chicken and egg noodles. Easy and family-friendly.
ingredients: Chicken;Egg Noodles;Cream Of Chicken Soup;Cream Of Mushroom Soup;Sour Cream;Milk;Cheddar;Salt;Pepper;Parsley;Onion
method: Preheat oven to 180°C || Cook egg noodles according to package instructions and drain || In a large bowl, combine chicken, noodles, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream and milk || Stir in half of the cheese and season with salt and pepper || Spoon mixture into a greased baking dish || Sprinkle remaining cheese over the top || Bake 30–40 minutes until bubbling and golden on top
notes: Servings and prep time not specified in source; cook_time_mins set to lower bound of stated 30–40 minutes.

name: Baked Cream Cheese Beef-Spaghetti
description: Comforting baked spaghetti tossed with cream cheese and a meaty tomato sauce, topped with Parmesan and mozzarella.
ingredients: Spaghetti;Beef Mince;Spaghetti Sauce;Cream Cheese;Garlic;Italian Herbs;Garlic Salt;Parmesan;Mozzarella
method: Preheat oven to 180°C and lightly grease an ovenproof dish || Cook spaghetti in lightly salted water until just tender (~12 minutes); drain || Meanwhile brown the mince over medium-high heat 5–7 minutes and drain excess fat || Stir spaghetti sauce into the mince and simmer briefly || Place hot spaghetti in a large bowl; add cream cheese, garlic, Italian herbs and garlic salt; mix until cream cheese melts and coats the pasta || Spoon a thin layer of meat sauce into the bottom of the prepared dish || Top with the spaghetti and cover with remaining meat sauce || Sprinkle Parmesan and mozzarella over the top || Bake ~30 minutes until bubbling and golden
notes: Add mushrooms or spinach to the meat sauce for extra veg; serve with green salad and garlic bread.

name: Pineapple Chicken
description: Sweet-savory pineapple chicken thighs cooked in a sticky pineapple-soy glaze.
ingredients: Pineapple Juice;Chicken Thighs;Garlic;Paprika;Black Pepper;Salt;Water;Soy Sauce;Mustard;Tomato Sauce;Honey
method: Place chicken thighs in a pot with pineapple juice and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated || When chicken begins to brown, add garlic, paprika, black pepper, salt, water and soy sauce and mix well || Cover and cook about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally || When chicken is browned and cooked through, stir in mustard, tomato sauce and honey and combine until glossy || Serve over rice, mashed potatoes or on its own
notes: Recipe cooks until liquid reduces then finishes with a sticky glaze.

name: Baked Mozzarella-Stuffed Meatballs
description: Juicy beef-and-pork meatballs stuffed with mozzarella, baked and simmered briefly in marinara sauce.
method: Preheat oven to 200°C || In a large bowl combine pork, beef, breadcrumbs, mozzarella, Parmesan, egg, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper; mix well || Scoop about 1 tbsp of mixture, flatten in your hand, place a small cube of mozzarella in the centre, wrap meat around it and roll into a ball || Place meatballs on a lined baking sheet || Bake 20–25 minutes until golden and cooked through || Meanwhile heat marinara sauce gently in a saucepan || Add cooked meatballs to sauce and simmer a few minutes so flavours meld || Serve warm garnished with basil
notes: Can add chilli flakes for heat; freezes well before or after baking; serve with pasta, rice or in a sandwich.

name: Steak Fajita Stir-Fry
description: Quick marinated steak fajita-style stir-fry with peppers and onions, served in warm tortillas.
ingredients: Steak;Bell Pepper;Bell Pepper;Onion;Olive Oil;Lime Juice;Chili Powder;Cumin;Cayenne Pepper;Salt;Black Pepper;Garlic;Tortillas;Guacamole;Sour Cream;Salsa;Coriander;Cheese
method: Place meat strips in a sealable bag; place sliced peppers and onions in a separate bag || Whisk together olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, cayenne, salt, pepper and garlic || Pour 1/3 of the marinade over the meat, 1/3 over the vegetables and reserve the remaining 1/3 for later || Seal bags and chill 1 hour to overnight || Heat a large pan over medium-high heat and stir-fry the vegetables about 5 minutes until just tender-crisp; remove and keep warm || In the same pan, cook the meat 7–10 minutes until browned and cooked through || Return vegetables to the pan, add remaining marinade and heat 1–2 minutes || Serve warm in tortillas with desired toppings
notes: Marinate 1 hour to overnight for best flavour.

name: Cheesy Garlic Chicken Wraps
description: Quick cheesy garlic chicken wraps — crisp outside, cheesy inside.
ingredients: Chicken Breast;Mozzarella;Cheddar;Flour Wraps;Butter;Garlic;Mayonnaise;Sour Cream;Garlic Powder;Onion Powder;Paprika;Parsley;Salt;Pepper
method: Mix mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt and pepper || Add chicken and mix until well coated || Place a wrap flat and sprinkle mozzarella and cheddar down the centre || Spoon chicken mixture on top, fold sides and roll tightly || Mix melted butter and minced garlic and brush the outside of the wraps || Grill in a pan 2–3 minutes per side until golden and cheese is melted || Garnish with parsley and serve

name: Braised Lamb Shanks
description: Slow-braised lamb shanks in a rich red-wine and tomato braising liquid; fall-off-the-bone tender.
ingredients: Lamb Shanks;Olive Oil;Onion;Garlic;Carrot;Beef Stock;Red Wine;Tomato Paste;Honey;Rosemary;Thyme;Bay Leaf;Salt;Pepper
method: Preheat oven to 160°C || Season lamb shanks with salt and pepper || Heat olive oil in a large ovenproof pot and brown shanks on all sides; remove and set aside || In the same pot add onions, carrots and garlic and sauté 5–7 minutes until softened || Add beef stock, red wine, tomato paste, honey and herbs; bring to a gentle simmer || Return shanks to the pot, nestle into the braising liquid and cover || Transfer to oven and braise 2½–3 hours (up to 3½ hours for extra tenderness) until meat is very tender and starting to fall from the bone || Serve over creamy mash, polenta or rice and spoon extra sauce over the top; garnish with fresh herbs
notes: If not using red wine, substitute ½ cup apple cider vinegar + ½ cup extra stock; longer cook time yields more tender meat.

name: Smothered Pork Chops
description: Crispy-seared bone-in pork chops finished in a rich onion gravy (smothered-style).
ingredients: Pork Chops;Onion Powder;Garlic Powder;Cayenne Pepper;Seasoning Mix;Salt;Black Pepper;Olive Oil;Flour;Butter;Onion;Garlic;Thyme;Chicken Stock;Buttermilk;Parsley
method: Pat pork chops dry and season with onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne, seasoning mix/salt and black pepper || Dredge chops in flour, shaking off excess and reserve remaining flour for the gravy || Heat 2 tbsp olive oil + 1 tbsp butter in a large pan and brown chops 3–4 minutes per side until golden; remove and keep warm || In the same pan add 1 tbsp butter, then sliced onions and a pinch of salt; cook until soft and caramelized (~10 minutes) || Add garlic and thyme for 30 seconds || Sprinkle 2 tbsp of the reserved flour over the onions and stir to form a roux || Gradually add chicken stock while stirring, scraping browned bits from the pan, and let thicken 1–2 minutes || Whisk in buttermilk or cream and simmer until creamy || Return chops to the pan, spoon gravy over them and simmer 5 minutes until pork is cooked through; thin gravy with extra stock or cream if needed || Garnish with parsley and serve
notes: Reserve some dredging flour to thicken the gravy; serve with mashed potatoes, rice or roasted veg.

name: Indian Beef Curry
description: A fragrant Indian-style beef curry simmered with whole spices, tomatoes and fresh coriander.
ingredients: Beef;Onion;Tomato;Garlic;Coriander;Cooking Oil;Salt;Water;Chilli Flakes;Turmeric;Garam Masala;Ginger Paste;Oil;Coriander Powder;Cinnamon Stick;Bay Leaf;Cumin Seeds
method: Marinate beef cubes with marinade spices (chilli flakes, turmeric, garam masala), ginger paste, 1 tsp oil and 1 tsp salt for 15 minutes || Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, cinnamon stick and bay leaves and let sizzle to release aromas || Add chopped onions and cook until translucent || Add garlic and cook until light brown || Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft || Add marinated beef and the ground spices (chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala) and sauté 1–2 minutes || Add warm water to just cover the beef, add salt to taste, reduce heat and simmer covered about 1 hour or until beef is tender (add water if needed) || When beef is tender, adjust seasoning and stir through fresh coriander before serving
notes: Simmer ~1 hour or until beef is tender; adjust water during cooking if needed; finish with fresh coriander.

name: Mac and Cheese with Beef (Casserole)
description: Layered casserole of seasoned beef base topped with macaroni in a cheesy sauce. Serves ~8.
ingredients: Tomato Sauce;Basting Sauce;Beef Mince;Crushed Biscuits;Onion Soup Mix;Eggs;Salt;Black Pepper;Macaroni;Cheddar;Milk;Butter;Flour;Mustard Powder
method: Preheat oven to 180°C || Mix tomato sauce and basting sauce and reserve 125 ml for later || In a bowl combine mince, crushed biscuits, onion-soup mix, eggs, salt, pepper and remaining 125 ml of sauce; press mixture into a 23×33 cm oven dish || Spread reserved sauce over the meat layer || Bake meat layer 30 minutes || Meanwhile cook macaroni until just tender and drain || Make cheese sauce: melt butter, stir in flour and cook 1 minute, whisk in milk until thickened, stir in 500 ml of grated cheddar, season with salt, pepper and mustard powder || Mix macaroni into cheese sauce || Remove meat from oven, spoon mac-and-cheese over the meat layer and sprinkle remaining 250 ml cheddar on top || Return to oven 20–25 minutes until golden and bubbling || Let rest 10 minutes before slicing and serving
notes: Serves approx. 8; total time ~65 minutes including resting.

name: Potato, Egg, Ham & Cheese Casserole
description: Creamy baked casserole with potatoes, ham, eggs and melted cheese — great for breakfast or brunch.
method: Preheat oven to 180°C || Boil potato cubes in salted water 8–10 minutes until just tender; drain || Place potatoes in a large greased baking dish || Scatter ham, green onions and half the cheddar & mozzarella over the potatoes || Whisk eggs, milk, salt, pepper, paprika and garlic powder || Pour egg mixture over the potato and ham layer || Sprinkle remaining cheese over the top || Bake 35–45 minutes until set and cheese is golden and bubbling || Let stand 5 minutes, cut into portions and serve warm
notes: Add vegetables like peppers, mushrooms or spinach; use bacon for smoky flavour.

name: Honey Garlic Chicken with Mushrooms
description: Quick pan chicken with mushrooms in a honey-soy garlic glaze, served over rice or noodles.
method: Season chicken with salt and pepper and sear in olive oil until golden || Add butter and garlic and sauté until aromatic || Add mushrooms and cook until soft and browned || Stir in honey and soy sauce and simmer until sauce is glossy and slightly reduced || Serve with rice or noodles
notes: Simple weeknight recipe; timings depend on slice thickness of chicken.

name: Beef Stew
description: Hearty beef stew with root vegetables slow-simmered in a rich beef broth.
method: Toss beef with flour, salt and pepper to coat || Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat and brown beef in batches; remove and set aside || In the same pot add onion and garlic and sauté until softened || Return beef to the pot and add beef stock, tomato paste, thyme and bay leaf; bring to a simmer, reduce heat and cook covered ~1 hour || Add carrots, potatoes and celery and simmer another 30–40 minutes until vegetables and meat are tender || Remove bay leaf, adjust seasoning and serve hot with bread, rice or pap
notes: Use oxtail for a richer flavour; simmer until meat is very tender.

name: Garlic Butter Cheese Pork Chops
description: Pan-seared pork chops finished in a garlicky butter sauce with melted cheese on top.
ingredients: Pork Chops;Salt;Black Pepper;Garlic Powder;Butter;Olive Oil;Onion;Garlic;Mixed Herbs;Chicken Stock;Cream;Dijon Mustard;Mozzarella;Parsley
method: Season chops with salt, pepper and garlic powder || Melt butter with oil in a large pan over medium-high heat and brown chops 3–4 minutes per side; remove and set aside || In the same pan sauté onion until soft, add garlic and herbs and cook 1 minute || Add chicken stock and simmer briefly, then stir in cream and mustard and reduce to a creamy sauce || Return chops to the pan, spoon sauce over them and simmer 10–15 minutes until cooked through || Sprinkle cheese over each chop, cover and allow cheese to melt 3–4 minutes || Garnish with parsley and serve
notes: Can be made in a slow cooker (4–5 hours on low) and finish with melted cheese at the end.

name: Bacon Potato Bake
description: Creamy bacon and potato bake topped with melted cheddar — a hearty side or main.
method: Preheat oven to 190°C || Place sliced potatoes in a baking dish and brush with melted butter || Sprinkle French onion soup mix over the potatoes so it seeps between slices || Pour cream over the potatoes so it seeps between slices || Scatter crumbled bacon over the potatoes || Cover with foil and bake 45 minutes || Remove foil, sprinkle grated cheddar and bake uncovered 15 minutes until golden and bubbling || Garnish with parsley and serve warm
notes: Cover and bake 45 minutes then finish uncovered 15 minutes until cheese is melted and golden.
